interlinear-text.item: MSK baor wəzd ar gɨlistoni dʒəwoni [3]

phrase.item: Spring came in a flower garden of youth; bride as a flower and groom as a nightingale.
One is picking flowers and being vain a lot, another is drunk on spring life.
Spring came, a time of love, a flower of Wakhan does not sit in the corner neglected.
Let's go to the desert to view flowers, as we are young, let's enjoy, hey you, flower.
Spring came, the reason of youth came unexpectedly, it unawarely passes as if a stranger came.
You should know the value of being young and in love, because as a guest the young life will come to your door.
Spring came, the grasses and flowers are grown high, for the burning of love, the nightingale will burn many more times.
Don't burn me with your love; anyway, burning in your love is my dream.
